Raag Gond − Part 001 859 : 1 One Universal Creator God. Truth Is The Name. Creative Being Personified. No Fear. No Hatred. Image Of The Undying. Beyond Birth. Self−Existent. By Guru's Grace: 859 : 2 Raag Gond, Chau−Padas, Fourth Mehl, First House: 859 : 3 If, in his conscious mind, he places his hopes in the Lord, then he shall obtain the fruits of all the many desires of his mind. 859 : 4 The Lord knows everything which happens to the soul. Not even an iota of one's effort goes to waste. 859 : 5 Place your hopes in the Lord, O my mind; the Lord and Master is pervading and permeating all. ||1|| 859 : 6 O my mind, place your hopes in the Lord of the World, the Master of the Universe. 859 : 7 That hope which is placed in any other than the Lord − that hope is fruitless, and totally useless. ||1||Pause|| 859 : 8 That which you can see, Maya, and all attachment to family − don't place your hopes in them, or your life will be wasted and lost. 2

859 : 9 Nothing is in their hands; what can these poor creatures do? By their actions, nothing can be done. 859 : 10 O my mind, place your hopes in the Lord, your Beloved, who shall carry you across, and save your whole family as well. ||2|| 859 : 11 If you place your hopes in any other, in any friend other than the Lord, then you shall come to know that it is of no use at all. 859 : 12 This hope placed in other friends comes from the love of duality. In an instant, it is gone; it is totally false. 859 : 13 O my mind, place your hopes in the Lord, your True Beloved, who shall approve and reward you for all your efforts. ||3|| 859 : 14 Hope and desire are all Yours, O my Lord and Master. As You inspire hope, so are the hopes held. −− Raag Gond − Part 001 −− Raag Gond − Part 001 3

Raag Gond − Part 002 860 : 15 Nothing is in the hands of anyone, O my Lord and Master; such is the understanding the True Guru has given me to understand. 860 : 16 You alone know the hope of servant Nanak, O Lord; gazing upon the Blessed Vision of the Lord's Darshan, he is satisfied. ||4||1|| 860 : 17 Gond, Fourth Mehl: 860 : 18 Serve such a Lord, and ever meditate on Him, who in an instant erases all sins and mistakes. 860 : 19 If someone forsakes the Lord and places his hopes in another, then all his service to the Lord is rendered fruitless. 860 : 20 O my mind, serve the Lord, the Giver of peace; serving Him, all your hunger shall depart. ||1|| 860 : 21 O my mind, place your faith in the Lord. 860 : 22 Wherever I go, my Lord and Master is there with me. The Lord saves the honor of His humble servants and slaves. ||1||Pause|| 4

860 : 23 If you tell your sorrows to another, then he, in return, will tell you of his greater sorrows. 860 : 24 So tell your sorrows to the Lord, your Lord and Master, who shall instantly dispel your pain. 860 : 25 Forsaking such a Lord God, if you tell your sorrows to another, then you shall die of shame. ||2|| 860 : 26 The relatives, friends and siblings of the world that you see, O my mind, all meet with you for their own purposes. 860 : 27 And that day, when their self−interests are not served, on that day, they shall not come near you. 860 : 28 O my mind, serve your Lord, day and night; He shall help you in good times and bad. ||3|| 860 : 29 Why place your faith in anyone, O my mind, who cannot come to your rescue at the last instant? 860 : 30 Chant the Lord's Mantra, take the Guru's Teachings, and meditate on Him. In the end, the Lord saves those who love Him in their consciousness. 860 : 31 Servant Nanak speaks: night and day, chant the Lord's Name, O Saints; this is the only true hope for emancipation. ||4||2|| Raag Gond − Part 002 5

860 : 32 Gond, Fourth Mehl: 860 : 33 Remembering the Lord in meditation, you shall find bliss and peace forever deep within, and your mind will become tranquil and cool. 860 : 34 It is like the harsh sun of Maya, with its burning heat; seeing the moon, the Guru, its heat totally vanishes. ||1|| 860 : 35 O my mind, night and day, meditate, and chant the Lord's Name. 860 : 36 Here and hereafter, He shall protect you, everywhere; serve such a God forever. ||1||Pause|| 860 : 37 Meditate on the Lord, who contains all treasures, O my mind; as Gurmukh, search for the jewel, the Lord. 860 : 38 Those who meditate on the Lord, find the Lord, my Lord and Master; I wash the feet of those slaves of the Lord. ||2|| 860 : 39 One who realizes the Word of the Shabad, obtains the sublime essence of the Lord; such a Saint is lofty and sublime, the greatest of the great. 860 : 40 Raag Gond − Part 002 6
The Lord Himself magnifies the glory of that humble servant. No one can lessen or decrease that glory, not even a bit. ||3|| −− Raag Gond − Part 002 −− Raag Gond − Part 002 7

Raag Gond − Part 003 861 : 41 He shall give you peace, O my mind; meditate forever, every day on Him, with your palms pressed together. 861 : 42 Please bless servant Nanak with this one gift, O Lord, that Your feet may dwell within my heart forever. ||4||3|| 861 : 43 Gond, Fourth Mehl: 861 : 44 All the kings, emperors, nobles, lords and chiefs are false and transitory, engrossed in duality − know this well. 861 : 45 The eternal Lord is permanent and unchanging; meditate on Him, O my mind, and you shall be approved. ||1|| 861 : 46 O my mind, vibrate, and meditate on the Lord's Name, which shall be your defender forever. 861 : 47 One who obtains the Mansion of the Lord's Presence, through the Word of the Guru's Teachings − no one else's power is as great as his. ||1||Pause|| 861 : 48 All the wealthy, high class property owners which you see, O my mind, shall vanish, like the fading color of the safflower. 8

861 : 49 Serve the True, Immaculate Lord forever, O my mind, and you shall be honored in the Court of the Lord. ||2|| 861 : 50 There are four castes: Brahmin, Kh'shaatriya, Soodra and Vaishya, and there are four stages of life. One who meditates on the Lord, is the most distinguished and renowned. 861 : 51 The poor castor oil plant, growing near the sandalwood tree, becomes fragrant; in the same way, the sinner, associating with the Saints, becomes acceptable and approved. ||3|| 861 : 52 He, within whose heart the Lord abides, is the highest of all, and the purest of all. 861 : 53 Servant Nanak washes the feet of thM at humble servant of the Lord; he may be from a low class family, but he is now the Lord's servant. ||4||4|| 861 : 54 Gond, Fourth Mehl: 861 : 55 The Lord, the Inner−knower, the Searcher of hearts, is all−pervading. As the Lord causes them to act, so do they act. 861 : 56 So serve forever such a Lord, O my mind, who will protect you from everything. ||1|| 861 : 57 O my mind, meditate on the Lord, and read about the Lord every day. Raag Gond − Part 003 9

861 : 58 Other than the Lord, no one can kill you or save you; so why do you worry, O my mind? ||1||Pause|| 861 : 59 The Creator created the entire universe, and infused His Light into it. 861 : 60 The One Lord speaks, and the One Lord causes all to speak.The Perfect Guru has revealed the One Lord. ||2|| 861 : 61 The Lord is with you, inside and out; tell me, O mind, how can You hide anything from Him? 861 : 62 Serve the Lord open−heartedly, and then, O my mind, you shall find total peace. ||3|| 861 : 63 Everything is under His control; He is the greatest of all. O my mind, meditate forever on Him. 861 : 64 O Servant Nanak, that Lord is always with you. Meditate forever on your Lord, and He shall emancipate you. ||4||5|| 861 : 65 Gond, Fourth Mehl: 861 : 66 My mind yearns so deeply for the Blessed Vision of the Lord's Darshan, like the thirsty man without water. ||1|| Raag Gond − Part 003 10

861 : 67 My mind is pierced through by the arrow of the Lord's Love. 861 : 68 The Lord God knows my anguish, and the pain deep within my mind. ||1||Pause|| 861 : 69 Whoever tells me the Stories of my Beloved Lord is my Sibling of Destiny, and my friend. ||2|| −− Raag Gond − Part 003 −− Raag Gond − Part 003 11

Raag Gond − Part 004 862 : 70 Come, and join together, O my companions; let's sing the Glorious Praises of my God, and follow the comforting advice of the True Guru.. ||3|| 862 : 71 Please fulfill the hopes of servant Nanak, O Lord; his body finds peace and tranquility in the Blessed Vision of the Lord's Darshan. ||4||6|| 862 : 72 First set of six. || 862 : 73 Raag Gond, Fifth Mehl, Chau−Padas, First House: 862 : 74 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 862 : 75 He is the Creator of all, He is the Enjoyer of all. ||1||Pause|| 862 : 76 The Creator listens, and the Creator sees. 862 : 77 The Creator is unseen, and the Creator is seen. 862 : 78 The Creator forms, and the Creator destroys. 12

862 : 79 The Creator touches, and the Creator is detached. ||1|| 862 : 80 The Creator is the One who speaks, and the Creator is the One who understands. 862 : 81 The Creator comes, and the Creator also goes. 862 : 82 The Creator is absolute and without qualities; the Creator is related, with the most excellent qualities. 862 : 83 By Guru's Grace, Nanak looks upon all the same. ||2||1|| 862 : 84 Gond, Fifth Mehl: 862 : 85 You are caught, like the fish and the monkey; you are entangled in the transitory world. 862 : 86 Your foot−steps and your breaths are numbered; only by singing the Glorious Praises of the Lord will you be saved. ||1|| 862 : 87 O mind, reform yourself, and forsake your aimless wandering. 862 : 88 Raag Gond − Part 004 13

You have found no place of rest for yourself; so why do you try to teach others? ||1||Pause|| 862 : 89 Like the elephant, driven by sexual desire, you are attached to your family. 862 : 90 People are like birds that come together, and fly apart again; you shall become stable and steady, only when you meditate on the Lord, Har, Har, in the Company of the Holy. ||2|| 862 : 91 Like the fish, which perishes because of its desire to taste, the fool is ruined by his greed. 862 : 92 You have fallen under the power of the five thieves; escape is only possible in the Sanctuary of the Lord. ||3|| 862 : 93 Be Merciful to me, O Destroyer of the pains of the meek; all beings and creatures belong to You. 862 : 94 May I obtain the gift of always seeing the Blessed Vision of Your Darshan; meeting with You, Nanak is the slave of Your slaves. ||4||2|| 862 : 95 Raag Gond, Fifth Mehl, Chau−Padas, Second House: 862 : 96 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 862 : 97 Raag Gond − Part 004 14

He fashioned the soul and the breath of life, 862 : 98 and infused His Light into the dust; 862 : 99 He exalted you and gave you everything to use, and food to eat and enjoy 862 : 100 − how can you forsake that God, you fool! Where else will you go? ||1|| 862 : 101 Commit yourself to the service of the Transcendent Lord. 862 : 102 Through the Guru, one understands the Immaculate, Divine Lord. ||1||Pause|| 862 : 103 He created plays and dramas of all sorts; 862 : 104 He creates and destroys in an instant; 862 : 105 His state and condition cannot be described. 862 : 106 Meditate forever on that God, O my mind. ||2|| 862 : 107 Raag Gond − Part 004 15
The unchanging Lord does not come or go. 862 : 108 His Glorious Virtues are infinite; how many of them can I count? −− Raag Gond − Part 004 −− Raag Gond − Part 004 16

Raag Gond − Part 005 863 : 109 His treasure is overflowing with the rubies of the Name. 863 : 110 He gives Support to all hearts. ||3|| 863 : 111 The Name is the True Primal Being; 863 : 112 millions of sins are washed away in an instant, singing His Praises. 863 : 113 The Lord God is your best friend, your playmate from earliest childhood. 863 : 114 He is the Support of the breath of life; O Nanak, He is love, He is consciousness. ||4||1||3|| 863 : 115 Gond, Fifth Mehl: 863 : 116 I trade in the Naam, the Name of the Lord. 863 : 117 The Naam is the Support of the mind. 17

863 : 118 My consciousness takes to the Shelter of the Naam. 863 : 119 Chanting the Naam, millions of sins are erased. ||1|| 863 : 120 The Lord has blessed me with the wealth of the Naam, the Name of the One Lord. 863 : 121 The wish of my mind is to meditate on the Naam, in association with the Guru. ||1||Pause|| 863 : 122 The Naam is the wealth of my soul. 863 : 123 Wherever I go, the Naam is with me. 863 : 124 The Naam is sweet to my mind. 863 : 125 In the water, on the land, and everywhere, I see the Naam. ||2|| 863 : 126 Through the Naam, one's face becomes radiant in the Court of the Lord. 863 : 127 Through the Naam, all one's generations are saved. Raag Gond − Part 005 18

863 : 128 Through the Naam, my affairs are resolved. 863 : 129 My mind is accustomed to the Naam. ||3|| 863 : 130 Through the Naam, I have become fearless. 863 : 131 Through the Naam, my comings and goings have ceased. 863 : 132 The Perfect Guru has united me with the Lord, the treasure of virtue. 863 : 133 Says Nanak, I dwell in celestial peace. ||4||2||4|| 863 : 134 Gond, Fifth Mehl: 863 : 135 He grants honor to the dishonored, 863 : 136 and gives gifts to all the hungry; 863 : 137 he protects those in the terrible womb. Raag Gond − Part 005 19

863 : 138 So humbly bow forever to that Lord and Master. ||1|| 863 : 139 Meditate on such a God in your mind. 863 : 140 He shall be your help and support everywhere, in good times and bad. ||1||Pause|| 863 : 141 The beggar and the king are all the same to Him. 863 : 142 He sustains and fulfills both the ant and the elephant. 863 : 143 He does not consult or seek anyone's advice. 863 : 144 Whatever He does, He does Himself. ||2|| 863 : 145 No one knows His limit. 863 : 146 He Himself is the Immaculate Lord. 863 : 147 He Himself is formed, and He Himself is formless. Raag Gond − Part 005 20

863 : 148 In the heart, in each and every heart, He is the Support of all hearts. ||3|| 863 : 149 Through the Love of the Naam, the Name of the Lord, the devotees become His Beloveds. 863 : 150 Singing the Praises of the Creator, the Saints are forever in bliss. 863 : 151 Through the Love of the Naam, the Lord's humble servants remain satisfied. 863 : 152 Nanak falls at the feet of those humble servants of the Lord. ||4||3||5|| 863 : 153 Gond, Fifth Mehl: 863 : 154 Associating with them, this mind becomes immaculate and pure. 863 : 155 Associating with them, one meditates in remembrance on the Lord, Har, Har. 863 : 156 Associating with them, all the sins are erased. 863 : 157 Associating with them, the heart is illumined. ||1|| Raag Gond − Part 005 21

863 : 158 Those Saints of the Lord are my friends. 863 : 159 It is their custom to sing only the Naam, the Name of the Lord. ||1||Pause|| 863 : 160 By their mantra, the Lord, Har, Har, dwells in the mind. 863 : 161 By their teachings, doubt and fear are dispelled. 863 : 162 By their kirtan, they become immaculate and sublime. 863 : 163 The world longs for the dust of their feet. ||2|| 863 : 164 Millions of sinners are saved by associating with them. 863 : 165 They have the Support of the Name of the One Formless Lord. 863 : 166 He knows the secrets of all beings; 863 : 167 He is the treasure of mercy, the divine immaculate Lord. ||3|| Raag Gond − Part 005 22
863 : 168 When the Supreme Lord God becomes merciful, 863 : 169 then one meets the Merciful Holy Guru. −− Raag Gond − Part 005 −− Raag Gond − Part 005 23

Raag Gond − Part 006 864 : 170 Day and night, Nanak meditates on the Naam. 864 : 171 Through the Lord's Name, he is blessed with peace, poise and bliss. ||4||4||6|| 864 : 172 Gond, Fifth Mehl: 864 : 173 Meditate on the image of the Guru within your mind; 864 : 174 let your mind accept the Word of the Guru's Shabad, and His Mantra. 864 : 175 Enshrine the Guru's feet within your heart. 864 : 176 Bow in humility forever before the Guru, the Supreme Lord God. ||1|| 864 : 177 Let no one wander in doubt in the world. 864 : 178 Without the Guru, no one can cross over. ||1||Pause|| 24

864 : 179 The Guru shows the Path to those who have wandered off. 864 : 180 He leads them to renounce others, and attaches them to devotional worship of the Lord. 864 : 181 He obliterates the fear of birth and death. 864 : 182 The glorious greatness of the Perfect Guru is endless. ||2|| 864 : 183 By Guru's Grace, the inverted heart−lotus blossoms forth, 864 : 184 and the Light shines forth in the darkness. 864 : 185 Through the Guru, know the One who created you. 864 : 186 By the Guru's Mercy, the foolish mind comes to believe. ||3|| 864 : 187 The Guru is the Creator; the Guru has the power to do everything. 864 : 188 The Guru is the Transcendent Lord; He is, and always shall be. Raag Gond − Part 006 25

864 : 189 Says Nanak, God has inspired me to know this. 864 : 190 Without the Guru, liberation is not obtained, O Siblings of Destiny. ||4||5||7|| 864 : 191 Gond, Fifth Mehl: 864 : 192 Chant Guru, Guru, Guru, O my mind. 864 : 193 I have no other than the Guru. 864 : 194 I lean upon the Support of the Guru, day and night. 864 : 195 No one can decrease His bounty. ||1|| 864 : 196 Know that the Guru and the Transcendent Lord are One. 864 : 197 Whatever pleases Him is acceptable and approved. ||1||Pause|| 864 : 198 One whose mind is attached to the Guru's feet Raag Gond − Part 006 26

864 : 199 − his pains, sufferings and doubts run away. 864 : 200 Serving the Guru, honor is obtained. 864 : 201 I am forever a sacrifice to the Guru. ||2|| 864 : 202 Gazing upon the Blessed Vision of the Guru's Darshan, I am exalted. 864 : 203 The work of the Guru's servant is perfect. 864 : 204 Pain does not afflict the Guru's servant. 864 : 205 The Guru's servant is famous in the ten directions. ||3|| 864 : 206 The Guru's glory cannot be described. 864 : 207 The Guru remains absorbed in the Supreme Lord God. 864 : 208 Says Nanak, one who is blessed with perfect destiny Raag Gond − Part 006 27

864 : 209 − his mind is attached to the Guru's feet. ||4||6||8|| 864 : 210 Gond, Fifth Mehl: 864 : 211 I worship and adore my Guru; the Guru is the Lord of the Universe. 864 : 212 My Guru is the Supreme Lord God; the Guru is the Lord God. 864 : 213 My Guru is divine, invisible and mysterious. 864 : 214 I serve at the Guru's feet, which are worshipped by all. ||1|| 864 : 215 Without the Guru, I have no other place at all. 864 : 216 Night and day, I chant the Name of Guru, Guru. ||1||Pause|| 864 : 217 The Guru is my spiritual wisdom, the Guru is the meditation within my heart. 864 : 218 The Guru is the Lord of the World, the Primal Being, the Lord God. Raag Gond − Part 006 28

864 : 219 With my palms pressed together, I remain in the Guru's Sanctuary. 864 : 220 Without the Guru, I have no other at all. ||2|| 864 : 221 The Guru is the boat to cross over the terrifying world−ocean. 864 : 222 Serving the Guru, one is released from the Messenger of Death. 864 : 223 In the darkness, the Guru's Mantra shines forth. 864 : 224 With the Guru, all are saved. ||3|| 864 : 225 The Perfect Guru is found, by great good fortune. 864 : 226 Serving the Guru, pain does not afflict anyone. 864 : 227 No one can erase the Word of the Guru's Shabad. 864 : 228 Nanak is the Guru; Nanak is the Lord Himself. ||4||7||9|| Raag Gond − Part 006 29
−− Raag Gond − Part 006 −− Raag Gond − Part 006 30

Raag Gond − Part 007 865 : 229 Gond, Fifth Mehl: 865 : 230 Deal and trade only with the Lord, Raam, Raam. 865 : 231 The Lord, Raam, Raam, Raam, is the Support of the breath of life. 865 : 232 Sing the Kirtan of the Praises of the Lord, Raam, Raam, Raam. 865 : 233 The Lord is ever−present, all−pervading. ||1|| 865 : 234 Joining the humble Saints, chant the Lord's Name. 865 : 235 This is the most immaculate and perfect occupation of all. ||1||Pause|| 865 : 236 Gather the treasure, the wealth of the Lord, Raam, Raam. 865 : 237 Let your sustenance be the Lord, Raam, Raam, Raam. 31

865 : 238 Never forget the Lord, Raam, Raam. 865 : 239 In His Mercy, the Guru has revealed this to me. ||2|| 865 : 240 The Lord, Raam, Raam, Raam, is always our help and support. 865 : 241 Embrace love for the Lord, Raam, Raam, Raam. 865 : 242 Through the Lord, Raam, Raam, Raam, I have become immaculate. 865 : 243 The sins of countless incarnations have been taken away. ||3|| 865 : 244 Uttering the Lord's Name, birth and death are finished. 865 : 245 Repeating the Lord's Name, one crosses over the terrifying world−ocean. 865 : 246 The Luminous Lord is the highest of all. 865 : 247 Night and day, servant Nanak meditates on Him. ||4||8||10|| Raag Gond − Part 007 32

865 : 248 Gond, Fifth Mehl: 865 : 249 My Lord and Master has held back the five demons. 865 : 250 He conquered them, and scared them away from the Lord's slave. 865 : 251 They cannot find the mansion of the Lord's devotee. 865 : 252 Joining together, the Lord's humble servants sing the songs of joy. ||1|| 865 : 253 The five demons are the rulers of the whole world, 865 : 254 but they are just water−carriers for the Lord's devotee. ||1||Pause|| 865 : 255 They collect taxes from the world, 865 : 256 but they bow in subservience to God's devotees. 865 : 257 They plunder and dishonor the faithless cynics, Raag Gond − Part 007 33

865 : 258 but they massage and wash the feet of the Holy. ||2|| 865 : 259 The One Mother gave birth to the five sons, 865 : 260 and began the play of the created world. 865 : 261 With the three qualities joined together, they celebrate. 865 : 262 Renouncing these three qualities, the Lord's humble servants rise above them. ||3|| 865 : 263 In His Mercy, He saves His humble servants. 865 : 264 They belong to Him, and so He saves them by driving out the five. 865 : 265 Says Nanak, devotion to God is noble and sublime. 865 : 266 Without devotion, all just waste away uselessly. ||4||9||11|| 865 : 267 Gond, Fifth Mehl: Raag Gond − Part 007 34

865 : 268 Suffering and troubles are eradicated by the Lord's Name. 865 : 269 Pain is dispelled, and peace takes its place. 865 : 270 Meditating, chanting the Ambrosial Naam, the Name of the Lord, I am satisfied. 865 : 271 By the Grace of the Saints, I have received all fruitful rewards. ||1|| 865 : 272 Meditating on the Lord, His humble servant is carried across, 865 : 273 and the sins of countless incarnations are taken away. ||1||Pause|| 865 : 274 I have enshrined the Guru's feet within my heart, 865 : 275 and crossed over the ocean of fire. 865 : 276 All the painful diseases of birth and death have been eradicated. 865 : 277 I am attached to God in celestial Samaadhi. ||2|| Raag Gond − Part 007 35

865 : 278 In all places and interspaces, the One, our Lord and Master is contained. 865 : 279 He is the Inner−knower of all hearts. 865 : 280 One whom the Lord blesses with understanding, 865 : 281 chants the Name of God, twenty−four hours a day. ||3|| 865 : 282 Deep within, God Himself abides; 865 : 283 within his heart, the Divine Light shines forth. 865 : 284 With loving devotion, sing the Kirtan of the Lord's Praises. 865 : 285 Meditate on the Supreme Lord God, O Nanak, and you shall be saved. ||4||10||12|| 865 : 286 Gond, Fifth Mehl: −− Raag Gond − Part 007 −− Raag Gond − Part 007 36

Raag Gond − Part 008 866 : 287 Bow in humility to the lotus feet of the Guru. 866 : 288 Eliminate sexual desire and anger from this body. 866 : 289 Be the dust of all, 866 : 290 and see the Lord in each and every heart, in all. ||1|| 866 : 291 In this way, dwell upon the Lord of the World, the Lord of the Universe. 866 : 292 My body and wealth belong to God; my soul belongs to God. ||1||Pause|| 866 : 293 Twenty−four hours a day, sing the Glorious Praises of the Lord. 866 : 294 This is the purpose of human life. 866 : 295 Renounce your egotistical pride, and know that God is with you. 37

866 : 296 By the Grace of the Holy, let your mind be imbued with the Lord's Love. ||2|| 866 : 297 Know the One who created you, 866 : 298 and in the world hereafter you shall be honored in the Court of the Lord. 866 : 299 Your mind and body will be immaculate and blissful; 866 : 300 chant the Name of the Lord of the Universe with your tongue. ||3|| 866 : 301 Grant Your Kind Mercy, O my Lord, Merciful to the meek. 866 : 302 My mind begs for the dust of the feet of the Holy. 866 : 303 Be merciful, and bless me with this gift, 866 : 304 that Nanak may live, chanting God's Name. ||4||11||13|| 866 : 305 Gond, Fifth Mehl: Raag Gond − Part 008 38

866 : 306 My incense and lamps are my service to the Lord. 866 : 307 Time and time again, I humbly bow to the Creator. 866 : 308 I have renounced everything, and grasped the Sanctuary of God. 866 : 309 By great good fortune, the Guru has become pleased and satisfied with me. ||1|| 866 : 310 Twenty−four hours a day, I sing of the Lord of the Universe. 866 : 311 My body and wealth belong to God; my soul belongs to God. ||1||Pause|| 866 : 312 Chanting the Glorious Praises of the Lord, I am in bliss. 866 : 313 The Supreme Lord God is the Perfect Forgiver. 866 : 314 Granting His Mercy, He has linked His humble servants to His service. 866 : 315 He has rid me of the pains of birth and death, and merged me with Himself. ||2|| Raag Gond − Part 008 39

866 : 316 This is the essence of karma, righteous conduct and spiritual wisdom, 866 : 317 to chant the Lord's Name in the Saadh Sangat, the Company of the Holy. 866 : 318 God's Feet are the boat to cross over the world−ocean. 866 : 319 God, the Inner−knower, is the Cause of causes. ||3|| 866 : 320 Showering His Mercy, He Himself has saved me. 866 : 321 The five hideous demons have run away. 866 : 322 Do not lose your life in the gamble. 866 : 323 The Creator Lord has taken Nanak's side. ||4||12||14|| 866 : 324 Gond, Fifth Mehl: 866 : 325 In His Mercy, He has blessed me with peace and bliss. Raag Gond − Part 008 40

866 : 326 The Divine Guru has saved His child. 866 : 327 God is kind and compassionate; He is the Lord of the Universe. 866 : 328 He forgives all beings and creatures. ||1|| 866 : 329 I seek Your Sanctuary, O God, O Merciful to the meek. 866 : 330 Meditating on the Supreme Lord God, I am forever in ecstasy. ||1||Pause|| 866 : 331 There is no other like the Merciful Lord God. 866 : 332 He is contained deep within each and every heart. 866 : 333 He embellishes His slave, here and hereafter. 866 : 334 It is Your nature, God, to purify sinners. ||2|| 866 : 335 Meditation on the Lord of the Universe is the medicine to cure millions of illnesses. Raag Gond − Part 008 41
